description.narrative:
The Project is expected to have a high development impact as it will help an IFC client to bolster its financial services and products to Paraguayan companies and individuals, supporting economic activity and job creation in Paraguay.
On an institutional level, by providing access to longer-term local currency financig, IFC will help Banco Regional to introduce new products in the financial system limiting foreign currency risk. On a sector level, the introduction of longer-term financing in the market will supply more options to SME's and individual borrowers, therefore generating a range of social and economic benefits which include promoting economic growth and raising productivity, as well as increasing banking penetration in rural areas. The anticipated development impacts of the Project are to:
- Enhance access to finance for SMEs. The Project will allow the Bank to provide its clients access to funding in Guaranies with longer maturities, enabling them to undertake investment projects with more appropriate financing structures;
- Generate a demonstration effect. The Project is expected to create a demonstration effect for other banks and further enhance IFC's developmental impact in Paraguay; and
- Assist in the deepening of Paraguay's financial sector by increasing access to finance for low-income groups and other priority sectors such as affordable housing.

The proposed investment involves supporting Banco Regional S.A. (Banco Regional or the Bank or the Company) in providing long-term financing in Guaranies to crucial sectors of the economy such as SMEs, and in facilitating increased mortgage lending especially for affordable housing.
The Project will be sourced through IFCs recently signed master swap agreement with the Central Bank of Paraguay.
